intro: Streptopus parasimplex, commonly known as the yellow starwort, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small yellow flowers in clusters. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
